intro: Deiregyne flavoferruginea, commonly known as the golden-orange balsam, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and somewhat succulent. The flowers are clustered in terminal racemes and are pollinated primarily by insects.
